englishTranslation: Come in! But you have to be in front.
vocabIncluded: adelante: in front (adverb often used with de)
using Tener with "que" to indicate obligation

spanishExample: Debe ir allí si quiere estar con su amigo.
englishTranslation: He must go there(specific) if he wants to be with his friend.
vocabIncluded: debe: must, he/she/it must (Deber, present, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Debemos ir para allá y luego hacia atrás.
englishTranslation: We must go over there and later backwards.
vocabIncluded: debemos:must, we must (Deber, present, 1st person plural)

spanishExample: Debo estar solo arriba porque no podía estar afuera con ellos.
englishTranslation: I must be alone upstairs because I wasn’t able to be outside with them.
vocabIncluded: arriba: up/upwards (adverb often used with de)
debo: must, I must (Deber, present, 1st person)
podía: "was able", "I was able" (Poder, imperfect, 1st person)

spanishExample: Él habla y puede que debas venir para acá.
englishTranslation: He talks and it might be that you must come over here.
vocabIncluded: habla: speaks, he/she/it speaks (Hablar, present, 3rd person)
para acá: over here/in this direction (idiom)

spanishExample: En el pasado estábamos lejos de ustedes.
englishTranslation: In the past we were far away from you all.
vocabIncluded: lejos: far (adverb often used with de)
ustedes: plural "you" after a preposition (prep. pronoun)

spanishExample: Hablo fuera de casa porque sé que pasa algo con ella.
englishTranslation: I talk outside home because I know something is happening with her.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
fuera: out/outside (adverb often used with de)
hablo: speak, I speak (Hablar, present, 1st person)
pasa: passes, he/she/it passes (Pasar, present, 3rd person)

englishTranslation: They should have(Deber preterite) said something to me.
vocabIncluded: debieron: had to/must have, they had to/must have (Deber, preterite, 3rd person plural)
me: "me" as an indirect object ("to me", "for me")

spanishExample: No hablas mucho con ella, pero deberías hacerlo.
englishTranslation: You don’t talk much with her, but you should do it.
vocabIncluded: deberías: should, you should (Deber, conditional, 2nd person)
hablas: speak, you speak (Hablar, present, 2nd person)

spanishExample: No he debido hacerlo, está mal.
englishTranslation: I have not had to(Deber participle) do it, it’s wrong.
vocabIncluded: he: "have", "I have" before a participle (Haber, present, 1st person)

spanishExample: No sé si está cerca, pero debes irte para estar con ellos.
englishTranslation: I don’t know if it’s close, but you must leave to be with them.
vocabIncluded: cerca: near (adverb often used with de)
debes: must, you must (Deber, present, 2nd person)
para: "in order", "in order to" before an infinitive

spanishExample: Nos dijo lo que pasó atrás del lugar.
englishTranslation: He told us what happened behind the place.
vocabIncluded: "lo que": "what" as a connector between phrases
atrás: back/backwards (adverb often used with de)
del: "of the" before a masculine noun
nos: "us" as an indirect object ("to us", "for us")
pasó: passed, he/she/it passed (Pasar, preterite, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Sé que algo va a pasar abajo.
englishTranslation: I know something is going to happen downstairs.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
using Ir and "a" to put verbs in the future (e.g. "voy a ser")
adelante: in front (adverb often used with de)

spanishExample: Solo habla sobre deber hacer eso.
englishTranslation: She only talks about having(deber) to do that.
vocabIncluded: habla: speaks, he/she/it speaks (Hablar, present, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Tenemos que hablar, ven para acá.
englishTranslation: We have to talk, come over here.
vocabIncluded: hablar: to speak / to talk (Hablar infinitive)
para acá: over here/in this direction (idiom)
using Tener with "que" to indicate obligation

spanishExample: Usted debería estar allá, dentro de la casa.
englishTranslation: You(formal) should be there(vague), inside the house.
vocabIncluded: debería: should, he/she/it should (Deber, conditional, 3rd person)
dentro: inside (adverb often used with de)
usted: "you", formal subject pronoun, taking 3rd-person treatment

spanishExample: Yo debería estar ahí porque estaban hablando de mí.
englishTranslation: I should be there because they were talking about me.
vocabIncluded: ahí: adverb meaning "there", especially when close to the speaker or listener
de used to mean "about", as in "hablar de"
